1.text: To every thing there is a season, and a time to every purpose under the heaven:

2.text: A time to be born, and a time to die; A time to plant, and a time to pluck up that which is planted;

3.text: A time to kill, and a time to heal; A time to break down, and a time to build up;

4.text: A time to weep, and a time to laugh; A time to mourn, and a time to dance;

5.text: A time to cast away stones, and a time to gather stones together; A time to embrace, and a time to refrain from embracing;

6.text: A time to seek, and a time to lose; A time to keep, and a time to cast away;

7.text: A time to rend, and a time to sew; A time to keep silence, and a time to speak;

8.text: A time to love, and a time to hate; A time for war, and a time for peace.

9.text: What profit hath he that worketh in that he laboureth?

10.text: I have seen the task which God hath given to the sons of men to be exercised therewith.

11.text: He hath made every thing beautiful in its time; also He hath set the world in their heart, yet so that man cannot find out the work that God hath done from the beginning even to the end.

12.text: I know that there is nothing better for them, than to rejoice, and to get pleasure so long as they live.

13.text: But also that every man should eat and drink, and enjoy pleasure for all his labour, is the gift of God.

14.text: I know that, whatsoever God doeth, it shall be for ever; nothing can be added to it, nor any thing taken from it; and God hath so made it, that men should fear before Him.

15.text: That which is hath been long ago, and that which is to be hath already been; and God seeketh that which is pursued.

16.text: And moreover I saw under the sun, in the place of justice, that wickedness was there; and in the place of righteousness, that wickedness was there.

17.text: I said in my heart: ‘The righteous and the wicked God will judge; for there is a time there for every purpose and for every work.’

18.text: I said in my heart: ‘It is because of the sons of men, that God may sift them, and that they may see that they themselves are but as beasts.’

19.text: For that which befalleth the sons of men befalleth beasts; even one thing befalleth them; as the one dieth, so dieth the other; yea, they have all one breath; so that man hath no pre-eminence above a beast; for all is vanity.

20.text: All go unto one place; all are of the dust, and all return to dust.

21.text: Who knoweth the spirit of man whether it goeth upward, and the spirit of the beast whether it goeth downward to the earth?

22.text: Wherefore I perceived that there is nothing better, than that a man should rejoice in his works; for that is his portion; for who shall bring him to see what shall be after him?
